greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(q) * chi(-q^3) * phi(-q^6) in powers of q where phi(), psi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^6) / (eta(q) * eta(q^12)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (288 t)) = 13824^(1/2) (t / i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A128583.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ q^3, q^6] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^6] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^(1/2)] / (2 q^(1/8)), {q, 0, n}];
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ q^2]^2 QPochhammer[ q^3] QPochhammer[ q^6]/ (QPochhammer[ q] QPochhammer[ q^12]), {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^12 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 27 2013
